Important
The premiums as mentioned above are for standard health as per the company's guidelines. You may have to pay additional/extra 
1. 
premiums after the underwriting assessment of your policy.
Premiums for Dai-ichi CI Plus are not guaranteed and may be subject to change in the future, subject to future regulatory approval.
2. 
The above benefits are illustrated with the assumption that all the premiums are timely and adequately paid.
3. 
The above Surrender Value is illustrated at the end of the respective policy year. It is the amount of policy cash value after the Policy 
4. 
has been in force for the given number of policy years, less any indebtedness.
Should you decide not to continue with this Policy, you could cancel it within 21 days from the policy issued date. This period is 
5. 
known as the Free-Look Period. In case the Policy is canceled within the Free-Look Period, the Company shall refund to the Policy 
Owner: i) all premiums received by the Company without any interest; minus ii) related health-check and examination expenses, if 
any.
Buying a life insurance policy is a long-term financial commitment. An early surrender of the Policy usually involves high costs and the 
6. 
Surrender Value payable may be less than the total premiums paid.
Upon the Life Insured's death or Total and Permanent Disability (TPD), the Death or TPD benefits will be paid out and the policy will 
7. 
be terminated.
Living Benefit is the periodic cash payment that is payable to the Policy Owner at the end of every three policy years (except at 
8. 
maturity date) while the Policy is still in force.
For Dai-ichi CI Plus, upon the Life Insured's death, TPD or Late Stage Critical Illness, the Death, TPD or Late Stage Critical Illness 
9. 
benefits, less any Early Stage Critical Illness benefit paid out.
The Early Stage Critical Illness benefits and Late Stage Critical Illness benefits, and Critical Illness definitions are stated in detail in 
10. 
the Policy Provision of this Plan.
The exclusions for Death, TPD, and Critical Illness benefits are stated in detail in the Policy Provision of this Plan.
11. 
This illustration will form part of the policy contract and must be read in conjunction with the Policy Provision of this Plan.
12. 
(This Sales Illustration is only for reference. Details of all benefits are regulated in Policy Provision of this Plan).
[For your convenience, Dai-ichi Life Insurance Myanmar Ltd. will bear the cost of stamp duty at the rate of MMK30 per MMK100,000 Sum 
Insured.]
Date - 23/12/2024
